section.heading: Disclosure of information.
section.text: Except as provided by law other than this chapter, during the collaborative law process, upon the request of another party, a party shall make timely, full, candid, and informal disclosure of information related to the collaborative matter without formal discovery. A party also shall update promptly previously disclosed information that has materially changed. The parties may define the scope of disclosure during the collaborative law process.

annotations.annotation: Uniform Law: This section is based on § 12 of the Uniform Collaborative Law Act.
